sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个副词均含"……以前"之意。
means: ago ：指从现在起往前推算一段时间，始终置于所修饰的词之后，与一般过去时连用。
before ：或指从过去某一时间起向前推算的若干时间的以前，通常与过去完成时连用；或泛指以前，并不具体指若干时间以前，可使用现在完成的或过去时；还可指从将来某一时间起的若干时间以前。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些前置词(短语)均含有"在……前"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: before, in front of, in the front of
means: before ： 指空间位置或时间的"在……前"。表时间时，反义词为after；指空间位置时，其反义词是behind。
in front of ： 指在某地方之外的前面，即不在其中，多与静态动词连用，通常可与before通用。
in the front of ： 指在某地方之内的前面，即在其中的前部分。

sentence.Network_en: The Koran recommends fasting as a penance before pilgrimages.
sentence.Network_cn: 《古兰经》劝告人们在朝圣前斋戒，以作为一种补赎。

sentence.Network_en: You have to pay your outstanding bill before joining the scheme.
sentence.Network_cn: 在参加该项目之前必须结清余账。

sentence.Network_en: Wash your hands thoroughly with hot soapy water before handling any food.
sentence.Network_cn: 在拿吃的之前，用热肥皂水把手好好地洗干净。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  beforan (see by, fore),of Germanic origin; related to German bevor

entry.def: If something happens before a particular date, time, or event, it happens earlier than that date, time, or event.

example.ex: Annie was born a few weeks before Christmas...
example.tran: 安妮出生在圣诞节前几周。

example.ex: Before World War II, women were not recruited as intelligence officers...
example.tran: 在第二次世界大战之前，女性不能当情报人员。

entry.def: If you do one thing before doing something else, you do it earlier than the other thing.

example.ex: He spent his early life in Sri Lanka before moving to England...
example.tran: 在移居英格兰之前，他早年是在斯里兰卡度过的。

example.ex: Before leaving, he went into his office to fill in the daily time sheet.
example.tran: 离开前，他到自己的办公室填写了日常考勤表。

entry.def: You use before when you are talking about time. For example, if something happened the day before a particular date or event, it happened during the previous day.

example.ex: The war had ended only a month or so before.
example.tran: 战争大约一个月前才刚刚结束。

entry.def: If you do something before someone else can do something, you do it when they have not yet done it.

example.ex: Before Gallacher could catch up with the ball, Nadlovu had beaten him to it.
example.tran: 加拉赫还没来得及追上球，纳德洛武就已经抢先一步触到球了。

entry.def: If someone has done something before, they have done it on a previous occasion. If someone has not done something before, they have never done it.

example.ex: I had met Professor Lown before...

entry.def: If there is a period of time or if several things are done before something happens, it takes that amount of time or effort for this thing to happen.

example.ex: It was some time before the door opened in response to his ring.
example.tran: 他按完门铃后过了一会儿门才打开。

entry.tran: （必须先具备某一条件）才能；在…之前（必须具备某一条件）
entry.def: If a particular situation has to happen before something else happens, this situation must happen or exist in order for the other thing to happen.

example.ex: There was additional work to be done before all the troops would be ready.
example.tran: 在全军准备就绪之前，还有一些杂事必须处理。

entry.def: If someone is before something, they are in front of it.

example.ex: They drove through a tall iron gate and stopped before a large white villa.
example.tran: 他们开车穿过一个大铁门，在一栋白色的大别墅前面停了下来。

entry.def: If you tell someone that one place is a certain distance before another, you mean that they will come to the first place first.

example.ex: The turn is about two kilometres before the roundabout.
example.tran: 拐弯就在环岛前面约2公里处。

entry.def: If you appear or come before an official person or group, you go there and answer questions.

example.ex: The Governor will appear before the committee next Tuesday.
example.tran: 下周二，州长将接受委员会的质询。

entry.def: If something happens before a particular person or group, it is seen by or happens while this person or this group is present.

example.ex: The game followed a colourful opening ceremony before a crowd of seventy-four thousand.
example.tran: 绚丽多彩的开幕式过后，这场比赛在74,000名观众的瞩目之下开始了。

entry.tran: 摆在…面前；使面对；使面临
entry.def: If you have something such as a journey, a task, or a stage of your life before you, you must do it or live through it in the future.

example.ex: Everyone in the room knew it was the single hardest task before them...
example.tran: 房间里所有人都清楚，摆在他们面前的是最为艰巨的任务。

example.ex: I saw before me an idyllic life.
example.tran: 展现在我眼前的是充满诗情画意的生活。

entry.def: When you want to say that one person or thing is more important than another, you can say that they come before the other person or thing.

example.ex: Her husband, her children, and the Church came before her needs.
example.tran: 丈夫、孩子和教会都比她本人的需求重要。

sentences.sentence: "he called me the day before but your call had come even earlier"
"her parents had died four years earlier"
"I see the lights of a town ahead"
"we couldn't see over the heads of the people in front"
"with the cross of Jesus marching on before"

auth_sentence.content: Has North Korea ever closed access to Kaesong before?
auth_sentence.res_content: Has North Korea ever closed access to Kaesong before?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Has North Korea ever closed access to Kaesong before?

auth_sentence.content: The market simply didn't see this before me!
auth_sentence.res_content: The market simply didn't see this before me!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The market simply didn't see this before me!

auth_sentence.content: Mr Michel also appeared before the inquiry on Thursday.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mr Michel also appeared before the inquiry on Thursday.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mr Michel also appeared before the inquiry on Thursday.

sentences.en: The man standing before the blackboard is our English teacher.
sentences.cn: 站在黑板前面的那个人是我们的英语老师。
我们在太阳升起之前起床。

sentences.en: You must pay attention to this problem before every thing.
sentences.cn: 你应该首先注意这个问题。

means.word_mean: (表示顺序)在…之前，（次序或排列）在前面

sentences.en: My name comes before his on the list.
sentences.cn: 在名单上我的名字排在他的名字前面。

means.word_mean: (表示目的)供…研究, 由…审判

sentences.en: The criminal case comes before the court.
sentences.cn: 那桩刑事案件已送法院审理。

sentences.en: It will be some time before we know the full results.
sentences.cn: 还要过一些时间我们才能知道全部结果。

means.word_mean: 先前; 从前; 以前；过去；已经

sentences.cn: 那部电影我们以前看过。

sentences.en: It came across my mind that I had met him somewhere before.
sentences.cn: 我突然意识到我曾在什么地方见过他。

jushi.english: The criminal case comes before the court.
jushi.chinese: 那桩刑事案件已送法院审理。

jushi.english: Great sums of money were placed before the scientists by the government.
jushi.chinese: 政府为科学家们提供了大笔的经费。

jushi.english: Before crossing the road, you should have a look at both ways.
jushi.chinese: 过马路之前,你应该看看路的两边。
